sections.heading: Project Keywords
sections.description:
Please fill in as far as you can, and leave blank all that does not apply to your work, or you don't feel is relevant. We want to be able to represent your work, but we also need some categories to give structure to all the data - for this we use a set of terms that might not totally comply with your understanding. For metadata collection here, we use 'ecosystem services' (ES) for all that people receive from nature. We also ask you to assign a place that represents your work best within a broad social-ecological system (--> 'aspects').

Each field also allows free-text, so you can supply additional project specific keywords.

fields.label: Ecosystem Service(s)
fields.info:
A list of keywords describing the research project to assist with searching and discovery.

ResNet intends to adopt a vocabulary reflecting shared terms and concepts across landscapes and themes. For now, enter keywords as free text. Keywords can be short phrases including spaces. Press enter to add the current text to the list, and begin typing to start another keyword.

fields.label: Summary
fields.info: A brief overview of the data products produced by this project.

fields.label: Title
fields.info: A descriptive, succinct title for the dataset.

fields.label: Format
fields.info: selectInput with choices = Tabular, Spatial Points, Spatial Polygons, Spatial Raster, Other

fields.label: Description
fields.info: What does the dataset contain and represent? What is the purpose of the data, how can it be used? What are the units of measurement?

fields.label: Methods
fields.info: How was the data created? Was it field data collected following a specific protocol? What was the protocol? Was it derived from existing products? How?

panels.title: Data Exceptions
panels.info:
Are there any circumstances that limit or preclude the publication (open access) of datasets produced by this project?

Examples include studies involving Traditional Knowledge, human subjects, sensitive data, and data with existing license restrictions, among other considerations.

See ResNet Data Policy.

fields.label: Exception Types
fields.info:
Check all options that apply to project data products.

See ResNet Data Policy.

fields.label: Description
fields.info: Detail the exceptions declared above. What are the specific conditions? Is a partial or anonymized release of project data feasible? Are there agreements in place with First Nations?

panels.title: Data Sources
panels.info: Many research project incorporate existing data products as inputs. Properly attributing these sources and documenting how they were used is an important part of reproducible research.

fields.label: Summary
fields.info: A brief overview of data products incorporated into this project.

fields.label: Title
fields.info: A succinct, descriptive title for this data source.

fields.label: Citation
fields.info: A formal citation for the dataset as provided by the creator or existing publications.

fields.label: Description
fields.info: Briefly describe the dataset source, purpose, format, and relevance to the research project.

fields.label: Methods
fields.info: Describe how the external data was incorporated into the research project.

fields.label: Location
fields.info: A URL or DOI that can be used to access the dataset.

fields.label: License
fields.info: Any licensing information provided by the dataset creator.

panels.title: Spatial Data
panels.info: Indicate whether any of the research project datasets contain a spatial component. For example, if field work was conducted and the coordinates of sites were recorded using a GPS.

fields.label: Spatial Datasets
fields.info: Describe the properties of each spatial dataset. These technical questions can be difficult. Provide what you can.

fields.label: Title
fields.info: This should match the title of a dataset listed in the Data Description section.

fields.label: Projection
fields.info: Any information available about the spatial projection of the dataset (eg 'lat/long, 'WGS84', 'EPSG:4326', '+proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +datum=WGS84 +no_defs').

fields.label: Resolution
fields.info: Where relevant, describe the spatial resolution of the dataset. This is always needed for raster data (eg 'cellsize = 30-m', 'cellsize = 1/8 arc second'). May apply to vector data as well (eg 'minimum mapping unit = 1 hectare').

fields.label: Comments
fields.info: Free text area for additional comments and information relevant to this research project documentation.

fields.label: External Resources

fields.label: Title
